decks.notes: Utilize powerful reanimation spells and disruptive cards to quickly cheat big creatures into play, overwhelming opponents before they can establish their own game plan. Use cards like Entomb and Animate Dead to fill the graveyard with threats, then bring them back into play for a quick victory. Control the game with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze, while also having access to versatile creatures like Brazen Borrower and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm to deal with threats on the board. This deck aims to win fast and decisively through explosive combos and efficient play.

This deck focuses on quickly locking down the opponent's mana sources with cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while also ramping into powerful creatures like Pyrogoyf and Fury. The goal is to apply pressure early on and disrupt the opponent's game plan by denying them their colored mana. By utilizing acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck?s aggressive strategy is further enhanced by Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's spells.

The primary focus of this deck is to assemble the combo involving Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to create a loop that allows you to draw your entire deck. This deck uses efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending to control the board while using Green Sun's Zenith to find key pieces of the combo. Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Will provide additional disruption to protect the combo. The deck also includes cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm for consistency and card selection.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield using Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck focuses on combining powerful creatures with disruptive spells like Force of Will to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with threats. The use of cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help ensure consistency in drawing into the combo pieces needed to execute the reanimation strategy efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower also adds versatility and flexibility to the deck's game plan.

This Doomsday combo Legacy deck focuses on quickly assembling the necessary cards to either win the game with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Thassa's Oracle, while using disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck runs a low land count with plenty of cantrips and tutors to find the combo pieces efficiently. The inclusion of Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal allows for explosive plays and acceleration. Overall, the deck aims to win the game in a single turn by carefully planning out the Doomsday pile.

The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal, while utilizing Show and Tell to drop powerful creatures onto the battlefield for free. The key strategy is to get Omniscience in play, allowing the player to cast spells without paying their mana cost. This enables the player to combo off with Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier, ensuring a quick victory. Additionally, the deck includes counterspells and card draw to protect the combo and find the necessary pieces.

The main objective of this Combo - Reanimator deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. By efficiently using cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Daze to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Troll of Khazad-d√ªm, and Archon of Cruelty. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Wasteland to protect its combo pieces and slow down the opponent.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by using counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It aims to control the game through card advantage and denying the opponent resources. The key concept revolves around using powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi, along with efficient spells like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will, to keep the opponent on the back foot while gradually building up its own advantage. The deck also utilizes cards like Hullbreacher and Lavinia to further disrupt the opponent's plans, while cards like Murktide Regent provide a potent win condition.

This Bant Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and tempo. With a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a strong win condition like Murktide Regent or Triumph of Saint Katherine. Utilizing versatile cards like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will, along with powerful enchantments like L√≥rien Revealed and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, this deck seeks to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent in a game of attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to use the combo of Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Nomads en-Kor to generate a large number of card draws and potentially win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes a variety of control elements such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Green Sun's Zenith and Stock Up provide additional searching and card draw to help set up the combo. Teferi, Time Raveler is included to provide versatility and control options.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom alongside cards like Nomads en-Kor and Bristly Bill, Spine Sower to create a powerful board state. It also includes control elements such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents. The deck also has some utility cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to execute its combo strategy while maintaining control over the game.

The main concept of this Dimir Tempo deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through efficient creatures and targeted disruption spells. By combining powerful tempo plays like Daze and Force of Will with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and force the opponent to play on the back foot. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Brainstorm helps to ensure consistency and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck seeks to maintain a balance between disruption and aggression to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Magus of the Moon, backed up by disruptive spells such as Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void, to quickly overwhelm the opponent and control the board. The deck also utilizes powerful red spells like Fury and Sundering Eruption for removal and finishing off opponents. With a high mana curve, the deck aims to use ramp cards like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Eldrazi creatures and powerful mana acceleration cards to quickly establish a board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By playing cards like Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to cast large Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule. Chalice of the Void is used to lock out opponents' spells, while Thought-Knot Seer provides disruption and card advantage. The combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements makes this Eldrazi Aggro deck a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and resources using counterspells, removal spells, and mana denial tactics. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through card draw and utility spells. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Tamiyo provides additional card advantage and potential for repeatable effects. The deck's mana base is designed to provide consistency and flexibility while also enabling the use of powerful multicolored cards like Prismatic Ending. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around efficiently controlling the game and outvaluing the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Atraxa and Archon of Cruelty using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then reanimating them with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Brazen Borrower and Daze to protect the combo. Wasteland is included to disrupt opponent's mana base. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats before they can respond effectively.
